    • registerUserSubmit

      @PostMapping("/register") public String registerUserSubmit(@ModelAttribute UserForm form, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      It takes in a UserForm object, which is a form that contains the user's username, password, email, and phone number. It then creates a new user object, and adds it to the database
      Parameters:
      form - The form object that is bound to the form in the view.
      model - This is the model object that is used to pass data from the controller to the view.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows you to add attributes to the redirect.
      Returns:
      A string

    • userProfile

      @GetMapping("/profile") public String userProfile(@RequestParam(name="id") int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirAttrs)
      If the user exists, return the user profile page, otherwise return the user list page with an error message
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user to be displayed
      model - This is the model object that will be used to pass data to the view.
      redirAttrs - This is a RedirectAttributes object that allows us to pass attributes to the redirected page.
      Returns:
      A user profile page.

    • deleteUser

      @GetMapping("/delete") public String deleteUser(@RequestParam(name="id",required=true) int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function is called when the user clicks on the delete button on the user list page. It takes the id of the user to be deleted as a parameter and returns the delete page
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the user to be deleted.
      model - The model is an object that holds the data that you want to pass to the view.
      Returns:
      A string

    • deleteUserConfirm

      @PostMapping("/delete") public String deleteUserConfirm(@RequestParam(name="id",required=true) int id, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      This function is called when the user clicks the delete button on the user list page. It takes the id of the user to be deleted as a parameter and deletes the user from the database
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the user to be deleted
      model - The model is an object that holds data that you want to pass to the view.
      Returns:
      A string that is the name of the view to be rendered.
